page.title: 08Parish Priest (Cont.)
page.content: Father McDonald tells us that he had wanted to be a priest since he was six when he became an Altar boy at St. Joseph's church, Birkenhead. Father and his family lived in Birkenhead for most of their childhood. He was educated at St. Joseph's Primary School, Hotten Hill Convent and finally at Urshaw College, Durham. Father was ordained to the priesthood on June the 12th, 1960 at the age of 24. Since his ordination to the priesthood he has worked as a curate in the Cathedral, Shrewsbury, the Sacred Heart, Morton and St. Joseph's church, Sale. He was assigned to the Holy Family as a parish priest in 1975.
